Subject: EvoCommander: A Novel Game Based on Evolving and Switching Between
 Artificial Brains
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=360532607; y=qxjdALJBW-UNdvQKbq-77gh8Ni_PAellMw3jEf0w60OJHVWZZcsjfP8
X-Yahoo-Profile: sebastian.risi
From: Sebastian Risi <sebastian.risi@...>

Hi all,

A while ago we asked you to play our new game EvoCommander, and now
Daniel Jallov, Julian Togelius and myself are happy to announce that
the paper about the game will appear in the IEEE Transactions on
Computational Intelligence and AI in Games. Thank you for your help!

The key design innovation in EvoCommander is the brain switching
mechanic. You can train multiple different neural networks for
different behaviors, some of which may be attacking tactics, others
tactics for hiding behind walls etc. When battling an opponent, you
can then decide which brain should be active at each point in time.

A preprint is available here:
http://sebastianrisi.com/wp-content/uploads/jallov_TCIAIG16.pdf

TCIAIG early access:
http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpl/login.jsp?tp=&arnumber=7419872

You can download the game here:
http://jallov.com/thesis/

Julian also wrote a nice blog post about it:
http://togelius.blogspot.com/2016/03/switching-brains-and-putting-cart.html

Looking forward to your comments!

Best,
Sebastian

-- 
Dr. Sebastian Risi
Associate Professor
IT University of Copenhagen, Room 5D12
Rued Langgaards Vej 7, 2300 Copenhagen, Denmark
